meanings.definition: Operate (a computer or device) at a speed higher than it was designed for.
meanings.sent1: I learned how to overclock my computer to make it faster.
meanings.sent2: Gamers often overclock their PCs to boost performance.
meanings.sent3: Trying to overclock a toaster to make it cook faster would be silly.
meanings.sent4: His brain seemed to overclock during the exam, processing information at lightning speed.
meanings.sent5: The car engine roared as if it had been overclocked for a race.

meanings.definition: Increase the operating speed of (a computer or device) beyond the manufacturer's specifications.
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to overclock your phone and cause damage.
meanings.sent2: Tech enthusiasts sometimes overclock their graphics cards for better performance.
meanings.sent3: If you overclock your alarm clock, you might wake up in a different time zone!
meanings.sent4: The athlete's determination seemed to overclock his legs, propelling him to the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The music player seemed to overclock, playing songs at double speed.
